trans-unit.source: Using the Box Connector in Logic Apps | Microsoft Azure App Service
trans-unit.target: Using the Box Connector in Logic Apps | Microsoft Azure App Service

trans-unit.source: How to create and configure the Box Connector or API app and use it in a logic app in Azure App Service
trans-unit.target: How to create and configure the Box Connector or API app and use it in a logic app in Azure App Service

trans-unit.source: Get started with the Box Connector and add it to your Logic App
trans-unit.target: Get started with the Box Connector and add it to your Logic App

trans-unit.source: Connect to your Box to get, upload, delete.
trans-unit.target: Connect to your Box to get, upload, delete.

trans-unit.source: and more to your files.
trans-unit.target: and more to your files.

trans-unit.source: Connectors are used in Logic Apps as a part of a "workflow".
trans-unit.target: Connectors are used in Logic Apps as a part of a "workflow".

trans-unit.source: You may have scenarios where you may need to work with Box that allows you to share data securely with anyone – even if they’re outside your firewall.
trans-unit.target: You may have scenarios where you may need to work with Box that allows you to share data securely with anyone – even if they’re outside your firewall.

trans-unit.source: Logic apps can trigger based on a variety of data sources and offer connectors to get and process data as a part of the flow.
trans-unit.target: Logic apps can trigger based on a variety of data sources and offer connectors to get and process data as a part of the flow.

trans-unit.source: Triggers and Actions
trans-unit.target: Triggers and Actions

trans-unit.source: The Box gallery app provides you Actions as mechanisms to interact with Box:
trans-unit.target: The Box gallery app provides you Actions as mechanisms to interact with Box:

trans-unit.source: **Actions**: The actions lets you perform predefined actions on the Box account configured with the logic app.
trans-unit.target: **Actions**: The actions lets you perform predefined actions on the Box account configured with the logic app.

trans-unit.source: Following are the actions that can be performed on Box account using Box connector:
trans-unit.target: Following are the actions that can be performed on Box account using Box connector:

trans-unit.source: a.
trans-unit.target: a.

trans-unit.source: *List Files:* This operation returns the information of all files in a folder.
trans-unit.target: *List Files:* This operation returns the information of all files in a folder.

trans-unit.source: List of parameters required for the action:
trans-unit.target: List of parameters required for the action:

trans-unit.source: Parameter Name
trans-unit.target: Parameter Name

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Required
trans-unit.target: Required

trans-unit.source: Folder Path
trans-unit.target: Folder Path

trans-unit.source: Path of the folder to list.
trans-unit.target: Path of the folder to list.

trans-unit.source: Yes
trans-unit.target: Yes

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] It does not return any file content.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] It does not return any file content.

trans-unit.source: b.
trans-unit.target: b.

trans-unit.source: *Get File:* This operation retrieves a file including its content and properties.
trans-unit.target: *Get File:* This operation retrieves a file including its content and properties.

trans-unit.source: List of parameters required for the action:
trans-unit.target: List of parameters required for the action:

trans-unit.source: Parameter Name
trans-unit.target: Parameter Name

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Required
trans-unit.target: Required

trans-unit.source: File Path
trans-unit.target: File Path

trans-unit.source: Path of the Folder where the File resides.
trans-unit.target: Path of the Folder where the File resides.

trans-unit.source: Yes
trans-unit.target: Yes

trans-unit.source: File Type
trans-unit.target: File Type

trans-unit.source: Specifies if the file is Text or Binary.
trans-unit.target: Specifies if the file is Text or Binary.

trans-unit.source: No
trans-unit.target: No

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] This operation does not delete the file after reading it.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] This operation does not delete the file after reading it.

trans-unit.source: c.
trans-unit.target: c.

trans-unit.source: *Upload File*: As the name suggests, the action uploads the file to Box account.
trans-unit.target: *Upload File*: As the name suggests, the action uploads the file to Box account.

trans-unit.source: If file already exists, then it is not overwritten and error is thrown.
trans-unit.target: If file already exists, then it is not overwritten and error is thrown.

trans-unit.source: List of parameters required for the action:
trans-unit.target: List of parameters required for the action:

trans-unit.source: Parameter Name
trans-unit.target: Parameter Name

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Required
trans-unit.target: Required

trans-unit.source: File Path
trans-unit.target: File Path

trans-unit.source: Path to the file.
trans-unit.target: Path to the file.

trans-unit.source: Yes
trans-unit.target: Yes

trans-unit.source: File Content
trans-unit.target: File Content

trans-unit.source: File content to be uploaded.
trans-unit.target: File content to be uploaded.

trans-unit.source: Yes
trans-unit.target: Yes

trans-unit.source: Content Transfer Encoding
trans-unit.target: Content Transfer Encoding

trans-unit.source: Encoding type of the content: Base64 or None.
trans-unit.target: Encoding type of the content: Base64 or None.

trans-unit.source: d.
trans-unit.target: d.

trans-unit.source: *Delete File*: The action deletes the specified file from a folder.
trans-unit.target: *Delete File*: The action deletes the specified file from a folder.

trans-unit.source: If the file/folder is not found, an exception is thrown.
trans-unit.target: If the file/folder is not found, an exception is thrown.

trans-unit.source: List of parameters required for the action:
trans-unit.target: List of parameters required for the action:

trans-unit.source: Parameter Name
trans-unit.target: Parameter Name

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Required
trans-unit.target: Required

trans-unit.source: File Path
trans-unit.target: File Path

trans-unit.source: Complete File Path including Folders.
trans-unit.target: Complete File Path including Folders.

trans-unit.source: Yes
trans-unit.target: Yes

trans-unit.source: Create the Box Connector for your Logic App
trans-unit.target: Create the Box Connector for your Logic App

trans-unit.source: A connector can be created within a logic app or be created directly from the Azure Marketplace.
trans-unit.target: A connector can be created within a logic app or be created directly from the Azure Marketplace.

trans-unit.source: To create a connector from the Marketplace:
trans-unit.target: To create a connector from the Marketplace:

trans-unit.source: In the Azure startboard, select **Marketplace**.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure startboard, select **Marketplace**.

trans-unit.source: Search for “Box Connector”, select it, and select **Create**.
trans-unit.target: Search for “Box Connector”, select it, and select **Create**.

trans-unit.source: Enter the Name, App Service Plan, and other properties:
trans-unit.target: Enter the Name, App Service Plan, and other properties:

trans-unit.source: Select **Create**.
trans-unit.target: Select **Create**.

trans-unit.source: Using the Box Connector in your Logic App
trans-unit.target: Using the Box Connector in your Logic App

trans-unit.source: Once your API app is created, you can now use the Box Connector as an action in your Logic App.
trans-unit.target: Once your API app is created, you can now use the Box Connector as an action in your Logic App.

trans-unit.source: To do this:
trans-unit.target: To do this:

trans-unit.source: In your logic app, open **Triggers and Actions** to open the Logic Apps Designer and configure your flow.
trans-unit.target: In your logic app, open **Triggers and Actions** to open the Logic Apps Designer and configure your flow.

trans-unit.source: The Box Connector is listed in the gallery.
trans-unit.target: The Box Connector is listed in the gallery.

trans-unit.source: Select it to automatically add it to your the logic apps designer.
trans-unit.target: Select it to automatically add it to your the logic apps designer.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] If the Box connector is selected at the start of the logic app, it acts like trigger.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] If the Box connector is selected at the start of the logic app, it acts like trigger.

trans-unit.source: Otherwise, actions can be taken on Box account using the connector.
trans-unit.target: Otherwise, actions can be taken on Box account using the connector.

trans-unit.source: The Box Connector doesn't have any triggers as of this writing.
trans-unit.target: The Box Connector doesn't have any triggers as of this writing.

trans-unit.source: Authenticate and authorize logic apps to perform operations on your behalf.
trans-unit.target: Authenticate and authorize logic apps to perform operations on your behalf.

trans-unit.source: Select **Authorize** on Box Connector:
trans-unit.target: Select **Authorize** on Box Connector:

trans-unit.source: Enter the sign in details of the Box account on which you want to perform the operations:
trans-unit.target: Enter the sign in details of the Box account on which you want to perform the operations:

trans-unit.source: Grant logic apps access to your account to perform operation on your behalf:
trans-unit.target: Grant logic apps access to your account to perform operation on your behalf:

trans-unit.source: List of actions is displayed and you can choose appropriate operation that you want to perform:
trans-unit.target: List of actions is displayed and you can choose appropriate operation that you want to perform:

trans-unit.source: Do more with your Connector
trans-unit.target: Do more with your Connector

trans-unit.source: Now that the connector is created, you can add it to a business workflow using a Logic App.
trans-unit.target: Now that the connector is created, you can add it to a business workflow using a Logic App.

trans-unit.source: See [What are Logic Apps?](app-service-logic-what-are-logic-apps.md).
trans-unit.target: See [What are Logic Apps?](app-service-logic-what-are-logic-apps.md).

trans-unit.source: View the Swagger REST API reference at [Connectors and API Apps Reference](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=529766).
trans-unit.target: View the Swagger REST API reference at [Connectors and API Apps Reference](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=529766).

trans-unit.source: You can also review performance statistics and control security to the connector.
trans-unit.target: You can also review performance statistics and control security to the connector.

trans-unit.source: See [Manage and Monitor your built-in API Apps and Connectors](app-service-logic-monitor-your-connectors.md).
trans-unit.target: See [Manage and Monitor your built-in API Apps and Connectors](app-service-logic-monitor-your-connectors.md).

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
